intro: Phoebe insularis, commonly known as the Bahamian phoebe, is a small evergreen tree native to the Caribbean islands. It typically grows to a height of 3 to 5 meters and has smooth, dark green leaves that are opposite in arrangement. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are white or pale yellow, followed by small, spherical fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
